ip-ver-pref.help: On dual-stack system the preferred stack: 4 for IPv4 and 6 for IPv6

addr-timeout.help: On dual-stack system how long to additionally wait for other stack's address in seconds

addr-timeout-mode.help: Address timeout mode; true: wait both stack's addresses; false: wait for preferred stack's address

ppp-enabled.help: Enable support for PPP interfaces (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

ppp-ipv4-enabled.help: Enable support for ipv4 PPP interface (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

ppp-ipv6-enabled.help: Enable support for ipv6 PPP interface (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

use-mbed-trace.help: Use mbed trace for debug, rather than printf

enable-ppp-trace.help: Enable trace support for PPP interfaces (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

socket-max.help: Maximum number of open TCPServer, TCPSocket and UDPSocket instances allowed, including one used internally for DNS.  Each requires 236 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

tcp-server-max.help: Maximum number of open TCPServer instances allowed.  Each requires 72 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

tcp-socket-max.help: Maximum number of open TCPSocket instances allowed.  Each requires 196 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

udp-socket-max.help: Maximum number of open UDPSocket instances allowed, including one used internally for DNS.  Each requires 84 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

memp-num-tcp-seg.help: Number of simultaneously queued TCP segments. Current default (used if null here) is set to 16 in opt.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

tcp-mss.help: TCP Maximum segment size. Current default (used if null here) is set to 536 in opt.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

tcp-snd-buf.help: TCP sender buffer space (bytes). Current default (used if null here) is set to (2 * TCP_MSS) in opt.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

tcp-wnd.help: TCP sender buffer space (bytes). Current default (used if null here) is set to (4 * TCP_MSS) in opt.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

tcp-maxrtx.help: Maximum number of retransmissions of data segments.

tcp-synmaxrtx.help: Maximum number of retransmissions of SYN segments. Current default (used if null here) is set to 6 in opt.h

tcp-close-timeout.help: Maximum timeout (ms) for TCP close handshaking timeout

pbuf-pool-size.help: Number of pbufs in pool - usually used for received packets, so this determines how much data can be buffered between reception and the application reading. If a driver uses PBUF_RAM for reception, less pool may be needed. Current default (used if null here) is set to 5 in lwipopts.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

pbuf-pool-bufsize.help: Size of pbufs in pool. If set to null, lwIP will base the size on the TCP MSS, which is 536 unless overridden by the target

mem-size.help: Size of heap (bytes) - used for outgoing packets, and also used by some drivers for reception. Current default (used if null here) is set to 1600 in opt.h, unless overridden by target Ethernet drivers.

tcpip-thread-stacksize.help: Stack size for lwip TCPIP thread

default-thread-stacksize.help: Stack size for lwip system threads

ppp-thread-stacksize.help: Thread stack size for PPP (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)
